column1: contents therein, this is not an absolute principle of law. In other words, failure to reply to
a business le(cid:425)er alone cannot decide the whole case. It is one factor which can be taken
into account along with other factors in determining whether the Plain(cid:415)ﬀ has proved his
case. Otherwise, when it is established that the formal demand, which is a sine qua non
for the ins(cid:415)tu(cid:415)on of an ac(cid:415)on, was not replied, Judgment can ipso facto be entered for the
Plain(cid:415)ﬀ. That cannot be done. Therefore, although failure to reply to a business le(cid:425)er or a
le(cid:425)er of demand is a circumstance which can be held against the Defendant, it cannot by
and of itself prove the Plain(cid:415)ﬀ's case. The impact of such failure to reply will depend on
the facts and circumstances of each case.”
